author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 56-year-old man died on the spot and three others including a former Minister sustained injuries after a car rammed into a two-wheeler at Pullur near Ulundurpet on Saturday. The deceased was identified as Dharmalingam of Kammapuram near Virudhachalam in Cuddalore district.

Police said Karthik (25) was riding a two-wheeler with his uncle Dharmalingam on the pillion.

The duo were proceeding to Kammapuram when the driver of a Toyota Innova car going from Chennai to Tiruchi lost control and hit the two-wheeler.

While Dharmalingam died on the spot, Karthik who was riding the two-wheeler sustained serious injuries.

Former AIADMK Minister K.K. Balasubramanian who was travelling in the car and the car driver Krishnamurthy sustained injuries and were admitted to the Ulundurpet Government Hospital.

A case has been registered.

title: Man dies in accident, former Minister injured
